tasks.title: Project Initialization and Environment Setup
tasks.description: Set up the project directory structure, initialize the Python virtual environment, and install core dependencies.
tasks.details:
1. Create project structure: `backend/`, `frontend/css/`, `frontend/js/`. 
2. Initialize virtual environment: `python -m venv .venv`. 
3. Install dependencies: `pip install flask flask-cors python-dotenv groq`. 
4. Create `.gitignore` to exclude `.venv` and `.env`. 
5. Create `.env` file for `GROQ_API_KEY`.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify directory structure exists. Run `pip list` to confirm flask, flask-cors, and groq are installed.

tasks.title: Core Flask Backend with CORS
tasks.description: Initialize the Flask application in backend/app.py with CORS support and basic error handling.
tasks.details:
1. Create `backend/app.py`. 
2. Initialize `app = Flask(__name__)`. 
3. Apply `CORS(app)`. 
4. Implement a health check endpoint `/health`. 
5. Set up basic logging and error handling boilerplate.
tasks.testStrategy: Run `python backend/app.py` and access `http://localhost:5000/health` via browser or curl to ensure 200 OK.

tasks.title: Groq AI Service Integration
tasks.description: Implement the AI conversion logic using the Groq API and the specific moonshotai model.
tasks.details:
1. In `app.py`, implement a POST endpoint `/api/convert`. 
2. Extract `text` and `target` (Upward, Lateral, External) from request body. 
3. Use `groq` client with `model='moonshotai/kimi-k2-instruct-0905'`. 
4. Define System Prompts for each target: 
   - Upward: Polite, formal, conclusion-first. 
   - Lateral: Respectful, cooperative, clear deadlines. 
   - External: Extremely polite, service-oriented, professional. 
5. Implement timeout logic (max 5s) and error catching.
tasks.testStrategy: Use Postman to send a JSON POST to `/api/convert` with sample text and target. Verify AI response and correct tone.

tasks.title: Frontend HTML Structure (Responsive)
tasks.description: Create the main HTML5 structure for the single-page application following the UI guidelines.
tasks.details:
1. Create `frontend/index.html`. 
2. Add `<header>` with title 'BizTone Converter'. 
3. Create a main container with two major columns/cards for 'Original' and 'Converted'. 
4. Add a `<textarea>` with `maxlength='500'`. 
5. Add radio buttons for target selection (Boss, Colleague, Customer). 
6. Add placeholders for character count and feedback buttons.
tasks.testStrategy: Open `index.html` in a browser. Verify all elements (input, radio buttons, result area) are present.

tasks.title: CSS Styling and Responsive Design
tasks.description: Apply the visual style guide including colors, typography, and mobile-first responsiveness.
tasks.details:
1. Create `frontend/css/style.css`. 
2. Implement Primary Color `#4A90E2`, Background `#F5F7FA`, and Text `#333333`. 
3. Use Flexbox/Grid for the 2-column desktop layout. 
4. Add Media Queries to stack columns vertically for width < 768px. 
5. Implement card shadows, button hover states, and input focus effects as per PRD.
tasks.testStrategy: Check UI on different screen sizes (inspect tool). Verify primary color is used on buttons and focus states.

tasks.title: Frontend Core JS: Input and Character Count
tasks.description: Implement client-side logic for real-time character counting and UI state management.
tasks.details:
1. Create `frontend/js/script.js`. 
2. Add event listener `input` on the textarea. 
3. Update a text element with `currentLength/500`. 
4. Add logic to disable the 'Convert' button if input is empty or exceeds 500 chars.
tasks.testStrategy: Type in the textarea and ensure the counter updates correctly. Verify character limit enforcement.

tasks.title: Frontend-Backend Integration (Async Fetch)
tasks.description: Implement the API call logic to connect the UI with the Flask backend.
tasks.details:
1. In `script.js`, handle the 'Convert' button click. 
2. Show a spinner inside the button. 
3. Call `fetch('/api/convert', { method: 'POST', ... })`. 
4. Display result in the right-side container. 
5. Implement `FR-05`: Show error message if API fails and provide a 'Retry' mechanism.
tasks.testStrategy: Submit text to convert. Ensure loading spinner appears, then result displays. Simulate a 500 error from backend to check error message.

tasks.title: Clipboard and UI Feedback Implementation
tasks.description: Implement the copy-to-clipboard functionality and visual feedback messages.
tasks.details:
1. Implement `FR-03`: Use `navigator.clipboard.writeText` to copy the result. 
2. Create a temporary toast or text notification '복사되었습니다!' (Copied!) upon success. 
3. Apply Success color `#50E3C2` for the feedback notification.
tasks.testStrategy: Click 'Copy' button after conversion. Paste in another app to verify content. Check for the visual feedback message.

tasks.title: User Feedback System (Helpful/Not Helpful)
tasks.description: Implement the simple feedback buttons to collect user satisfaction data.
tasks.details:
1. Add 'Helpful' and 'Not Helpful' buttons to the result card. 
2. Implement JS listener to send a POST to `/api/feedback`. 
3. Backend endpoint simply logs the feedback for now as per 'Want' requirement (FR-06).
tasks.testStrategy: Click feedback buttons and verify the request is sent in the Network tab. Check server logs for the feedback entry.

tasks.title: Deployment Configuration (Vercel)
tasks.description: Prepare the application for deployment on Vercel including serverless function config.
tasks.details:
1. Create `vercel.json` to route `/api/*` to the Flask serverless function. 
2. Ensure `requirements.txt` is updated. 
3. Configure static file routing for the `frontend/` directory. 
4. Set up environment variables in Vercel Dashboard for `GROQ_API_KEY`.
tasks.testStrategy: Deploy to Vercel preview branch. Verify both static UI and API endpoints work in the production URL.

subtasks.title: Create vercel.json for API and Static Routing
subtasks.description: Configure the project's entry points and routing rules for Vercel's deployment engine.
subtasks.details: Create a `vercel.json` file in the root directory. Define 'builds' for the Python backend and 'routes' to redirect `/api/(.*)` to the backend script and the root to the `frontend/` directory.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run 'vercel dev' locally to ensure that requests to /api are correctly proxied to the Flask server.

subtasks.title: Prepare Backend for Serverless Compatibility
subtasks.description: Adjust the Flask application to run as a serverless function on Vercel.
subtasks.details: Ensure `backend/requirements.txt` is up-to-date with all dependencies (Flask, flask-cors, etc.). If necessary, create a symbolic link or entry point file like `api/index.py` that exports the Flask 'app' instance for Vercel's Python runtime.
subtasks.testStrategy: Trigger a Vercel preview deployment and monitor the build logs for successful dependency installation and serverless function detection.

subtasks.title: Optimize Frontend for Vercel Deployment
subtasks.description: Configure the frontend assets to be served efficiently as static files.
subtasks.details: Verify the project structure ensures `frontend/index.html` is accessible. Update any internal script/link tags to use relative paths compatible with Vercel's static file serving and ensure CSS/JS files are correctly mapped in `vercel.json`.
subtasks.testStrategy: Access the production URL and verify that all CSS, JS, and image assets load with a 200 OK status.

subtasks.title: Configure Environment Variables and Security Headers
subtasks.description: Set up secrets and security configurations within the Vercel environment.
subtasks.details: Add `GROQ_API_KEY` to the Vercel Dashboard Environment Variables section. In `vercel.json`, implement security headers such as `X-Content-Type-Options`, `X-Frame-Options`, and `Content-Security-Policy` where applicable.
subtasks.testStrategy: Invoke an API endpoint that requires the API key and verify it functions correctly without exposing the key in the client-side code.

subtasks.title: Production Validation and Performance Audit
subtasks.description: Conduct a final check of the deployed application including SSL, speed, and Lighthouse metrics.
subtasks.details: Verify SSL certificate status in Vercel settings. Run a Google Lighthouse audit on the production URL to check Performance and Accessibility. Test API response latency to ensure the cold start of the serverless function is within acceptable limits.
subtasks.testStrategy: Review Lighthouse report for scores > 90 and manually verify SSL certificate validity in the browser.
